item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "What do you despise? By this are you truly known." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "The people I distrust most are those who want to improve our lives but have only one course of action." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Beyond a critical point within a finite space, freedom diminishes as numbers increase. This is as true of humans as it is of gas molecules in a sealed flask. The human question is not how many can possibly survive within the system, but what kind of existence is possible for those who so survive." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Governments, if they endure, always tend increasingly toward aristocratic forms. No government in history has been known to evade this pattern. And as the aristocracy develops, government tends more and more to act exclusively in the interests of the ruling class -- whether that class be hereditary royalty, oligarchs of financial empires, or entrenched bureaucracy." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "If you think of yourselves as helpless and ineffectual, it is certain that you will create a despotic government to be your master. The wise despot, therefore, maintains among his subjects a popular sense that they are helpless and ineffectual." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "The convoluted wording of legalisms grew up around the necessity to hide from ourselves the violence we intend toward each other. Between depriving a man of one hour from his life and depriving him of his life there exists only a difference of degree. You have done violence to him, consumed his energy." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "A beginning is the time for taking the most delicate care that the balances are correct. " -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Education is no substitute for intelligence." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "How often it is that the angry man rages denial of what his inner self is telling him." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "The beginning of knowledge is the discovery of something we do not understand." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "The concept of progress acts as a protective mechanism to shield us from the terrors of the future." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "What do such machines really do? They increase the number of things we can do without thinking. Things we do without thinking-thereâ€™s the real danger." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Show me a completely smooth operation and I'll show you someone who's covering mistakes. Real boats rock." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Nobody wants to be here and nobody wants to leave." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Just remember that the things you put into your head are there forever, he said. You might want to think about that. You forget some things, dont you? Yes. You forget what you want to remember and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "He walked out in the gray light and stood and he saw for a brief moment the absolute truth of the world. The cold relentless circling of the intestate earth. Darkness implacable. The blind dogs of the sun in their running. The crushing black vacuum of the universe. And somewhere two hunted animals trembling like ground-foxes in their cover. Borrowed time and borrowed world and borrowed eyes with which to sorrow it." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Then they set out along the blacktop in the gunmetal light, shuffling through the ash, each the other's world entire." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "When you've nothing else construct ceremonies out of the air and breathe upon them." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "never's the word God listens for when he needs a laugh." -- Stephen King

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A coward judges all he sees by what he is." -- Stephen King

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Stephen King
item.description:
"My friend wants to get moving and so do I,' Eddie said. 'We've got miles to go yet.'
I know that. It's on your face, son. Like a scar.'
Eddie was fascinated by the idea of duty and ka as something that left a mark, something that might look like decoration to one eye and disfigurement to another. Outside, thunder cracked and lightning flashed." -- Stephen King

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Laughter, Susannah would later reflect, is like a hurricane: once it reaches a certain point, it becomes self-feeding, self-supporting. You laugh not because the <i>jokes</i> are funny but because your own <i>condition</i> is funny." -- Stephen King

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Might as well try to drink the ocean with a spoon as argue with a lover." -- Stephen King

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "There is no God and we are his prophets." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You have my whole heart. You always did." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "He knew only that his child was his warrant. He said: If he is not the word of God God never spoke." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "When you die it's the same as if everybody else did too." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Dillon add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "When one has nothing left make ceremonies out of the air and breathe upon them." -- Cormac McCarthy
